repnme.cdata!:
Turkey - Baku-Ceyhan Oil Export Pipeline
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project was
            satisfactory, with a likely sustainability. However, the
            institutional development impact was modest, since only a
            very small number of staff from the Boru Hatlari ile Petrol
            Tasima A.S.(BOTAS) - the state owned company authorized to
            operate oil and gas pipelines - were actually involved in
            the implementation of the study to optimize the feasibility
            of the proposed pipeline project. Despite the relatively
            small project, lessons suggest that BOTAS could have
            financed the study itself, but the Bank assistance was
            requested in order to enhance the credibility of the study.
            This strongly suggests that for the Bank, the operation
            proved an expensive project per dollar loaned. However, it
            places the Bank in a better position to evaluate the export
            pipelines from the Caspian region - both oil and gas - and
            possibly assist with their financing.

repnme.cdata!:
Turkey - Baku-Ceyhan Oil Export Pipeline
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Baku-Ceyhan Oil
            Export Pipeline Technical Assistance Project are to: a)
            identify and evaluate technically viable and environmentally
            sustainable pipeline route options for the export of crude
            oil from Baku in Azerbaijan to the international markets
            throughout Ceyhan in Turkey, under various throughput
            assumptions; b) conduct optimization studies of the routes
            so identified to arrive at the most robust pipeline route
            and configuration which merits further and more detailed
            technical financial and economic evaluations; and c)
            recommend a realistic commercial structure for building,
            construction and operating the selected pipelines. The
            project will be carried out by one or more consultants and
            will consit of the following components: a) review and
            update existing studies by Boru Hatlari ile Petro Tasima
            A.S. (BOTAS) on the various pipeline routes; b) preliminary
            design, route survey, implementation plan; c) economic and
            financial analysis on various throughput assumptions to be
            agreed with BOTAS; d) commercial structure and development
            of Tariff models; and e) an environmental audit.
